title: (x) Neon / Queen - Eklektik / ITC Firenze {Lex, Mark S}
author: parker

comments.content:
NEON is Electrik (aka Eklektic). I can't find a reference for it anywhere online, but I have Eklektic on my machine. It came with CorelDraw, which means it's most likely from Bitstream.

- Lex

I found those sites, but they didn't seem legit to me. Does anyone know the real origin of Electrik?

- Lex
The bottom one is ITC Firenze I think, but it doesn't seem to be available in digital format (at least with that name).

Eklektic and Legerdemain are both digitizations of the old VGC typeface Elektrik (two k's) and either is about as legit a version as you are going to find.  Eklektic came with my version of CorelDraw (8) as well.  Eklektik has a Corel copyright,  not BT,  and Buyfonts is offering the old Fontbank fonts.

Firenze ITC is bundled also on the same CD.
Hi I am working on a mac. Does anyone know where i can get Firenze ITC?
It's still not available digitally, as far as I know.

There was an Image Club version on the old Letterpress CDs. I have it and could set some type if you wanted. I also think the font [Carousel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115031208/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/carousel/ef/characters.html) is similar.

- Mike Yanega

Here is your name in Firenze.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115031208im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FirenzeMichB_5740.gif)

Okay, sort of available. :-)

(Man, the spacing it terrible in that Image Club version.)

Yes, Grant Hutchinson said that sort of thing was one reason they dropped a lot of the old Letterpress fonts -- they weren't up to current standards. Of course, I could make tracking corrections to reduce the more obvious problems, if we're just looking at a few words of type.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you so much for your help Mark and Mike! I really appreciate it!

If you could get a copy of Corel Draw for Mac (version 8),  
Firenze comes with that.
